item.title: 普拉博沃希望将 200 亿美元的预算节余用于达纳塔拉项目
item.description: 印尼总统普拉博沃-苏比安托（Prabowo Subianto）周一表示，印尼将向新成立的达纳塔拉（Danantara）投资机构划拨200亿美元的预算节余，用于资助20个具有重大影响力的国家项目。【原文：Indonesia will channel $20 billion in budget savings to its newly created Danantara investment body to help finance 20 high-impact national projects, President Prabowo Subianto said Monday.】

item.title: KKR 斥资 4 亿美元收购印度 HCG 公司多数股权
item.description: KKR & Co Inc. 将从 CVC Capital Partners 手中收购印度 Healthcare Global Enterprises Ltd. 的多数股权，交易价值为 4 亿美元，从而使该私募股权公司成为印度癌症护理连锁机构的最大股东和唯一运营商。【原文：KKR & Co Inc. is set to acquire a majority stake in India’s Healthcare Global Enterprises Ltd. from CVC Capital Partners at a deal valued at $400 million, making the private equity firm the largest shareholder and sole operator of the Indian cancer-care chain.】

item.title: 因发现新病毒，韩国和香港的 Covid 相关股票大涨
item.description: 周一，亚洲诊断试剂盒和疫苗生产商的股票在一份关于中国蝙蝠冠状病毒研究的报告出现后大涨。【原文：Shares of Asian diagnostic kits and vaccine makers rallied on Monday after a report emerged about a new coronavirus study in bats in China.】

item.title: 德国投票结果出炉后，亚洲 DAX 期货随欧元上涨
item.description: 德国反对党领袖弗里德里希-梅尔茨（Friedrich Merz）在周日的联邦大选中获胜，与民意调查结果一致，为增加支出铺平了道路，此后德国股指期货和欧元在亚洲交易中双双反弹。【原文：Germany’s stock index futures and the euro both rallied in Asian trading after the country’s opposition leader Friedrich Merz won Sunday’s federal election, matching opinion polls and paving the way for a pivot to increased spending.】

item.title: 期权交易员在举足轻重的英伟达财报发布前做好对冲准备
item.description: 甚至在周五的下跌使美国股市从平静中惊醒之前，一些交易商就已经做好了动荡的准备。【原文：Even before Friday’s slide jolted the US stock market out of its calm, some traders were preparing for unrest.】

item.title: 监管机构称韩国有望在 3 月 31 日解除做空禁令
item.description: 据韩国最高金融监管机构称，韩国有望从 3 月 31 日起取消对所有股票的卖空禁令。【原文：South Korea is on track to lift its ban on short selling across all stocks starting March 31, according to the nation’s top financial regulator.】

item.title: 石油投机者态度转冷，看涨赌注被削减
item.description: 对冲基金对原油前景不再那么乐观，削减了净看涨押注，这是市场走软的又一迹象。【原文：Hedge funds are turning less optimistic on crude oil’s prospects, trimming net-bullish bets in a further sign of market softening.】

item.title: 日本吸引中国游客，泰国旅游目标岌岌可危
item.description: 在一名中国演员遭绑架后，大陆游客开始转向安全的日本和新加坡，泰国今年吸引多达 900 万中国游客的宏伟目标似乎成了疑问。【原文：Thailand’s ambitious goal of attracting as many as 9 million tourists from China this year looks in doubt, after the kidnapping of a Chinese actor started driving mainland visitors to the safety of Japan and Singapore.】

item.title: 印度市场热点：牛市受伤，但仍未丢弃毛巾
财政援助陷入困境，韩国央行可能恢复降息：决策指南
item.description: 由于唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）发动的关税战已对因政治动荡而受挫的企业和消费者信心造成影响，人们普遍预计韩国央行将在本周恢复宽松周期，以支持经济抵御关税战。【原文：The Bank of Korea is widely expected to resume its easing cycle this week in the absence of early fiscal stimulus, supporting the economy against Donald Trump’s tariff war that has already weighed on business and consumer confidence dented by political turmoil.】

item.title: 特朗普第二任期最大动作瞄准中国
item.description: 特朗普政府将矛头指向中国，采取了一系列涉及投资、贸易和其他问题的举措，这增加了美国与其头号经济竞争对手之间关系可能很快恶化的风险。【原文：The Trump administration took aim at China with a series of moves involving investment, trade and other issues that raises the risk ties may soon worsen between the US and its top economic rival.】

item.title: 交易商权衡美国经济疲软迹象，铝业涨势减弱
item.description: 铝从八个月高位回落，原因是周五美国经济数据疲软，金属市场涨跌不一，市场情绪依然谨慎。【原文：Aluminum extended its retreat from an eight-month high as sentiment remained cautious following a mixed session on Friday for metals after weak US economic data.】

item.title: 阿里巴巴将斥资 530 亿美元打造人工智能基础设施，实现重大突破
item.description: 阿里巴巴集团控股有限公司（Alibaba Group Holding Ltd.）已承诺在未来三年内投资超过 3,800 亿元人民币（530 亿美元）用于数据中心等人工智能基础设施，这一重大承诺凸显了这家电子商务先驱成为人工智能领导者的雄心壮志。【原文：Alibaba Group Holding Ltd. has pledged to invest more than 380 billion yuan ($53 billion) on AI infrastructure such as data centers over the next three years, a major commitment that underscores the e-commerce pioneer’s ambitions of becoming a leader in artificial intelligence.】

item.title: 中国人民银行的政策反转给降息时机带来困惑
item.description: 今年 9 月，在一次罕见的新闻发布会上，中国央行行长潘功胜公布了一项刺激政策，激发了市场对十年来最大政策转变之一的乐观情绪。但从那时起，希望获得更多支持的市场观察人士就开始挠头了。【原文：At a rare press briefing back in September, China’s central bank chief Pan Gongsheng unveiled a stimulus blitz that spurred optimism for one of the biggest policy shifts in a decade. But since then, market watchers wanting more support have been left scratching their heads.】

item.title: 马来西亚棕榈树洪灾问题将再持续一个月
item.description: 据一位业内高级官员称，马来西亚油棕种植园今年被雨水淹没，至少在一个月内产量不可能恢复。【原文：Malaysian oil palm plantations that have been inundated with rain this year aren’t likely to see production recover for at least another month, according to a senior industry official.】

item.title: 分析师称新加坡 50 亿新元的股票计划还不够
item.description: 新加坡计划通过向基金管理公司投资 50 亿新元（37 亿美元）来提振本地股票，这被认为是一个良好的开端，尽管分析师们认为此举不太可能长期提振整个市场。【原文：Singapore’s plan to boost local equities by investing S$5 billion ($3.7 billion) with fund managers is seen as a good start, though analysts say the move is unlikely to give the broader market a longer-term lift.】

item.title: 美国数据疲软刺激避险买盘，黄金维持在历史高位附近
item.description: 由于意外疲软的经济数据和不断上升的通胀预期帮助提振了避险需求，黄金交易量略低于上周的历史高点。【原文：Gold traded just shy of last week’s all-time high as unexpectedly weak economic data and rising expectations for inflation helped boost haven demand.】

item.title: 中国地方政府债券热潮加剧流动性紧张
item.description: 中国地方政府急于发行债券为隐性债务再融资，进一步收紧了金融体系的流动性。【原文：China’s local governments are rushing to issue bonds to refinance hidden debt, further tightening liquidity in the financial system.】

item.title: 中国开发商在住房规定放宽后溢价购地
item.description: 中国政府放宽了对房价的限制，以重振四年多来一直拖累经济的低迷市场，在此之后，中国国有背景的开发商又开始高价购买土地。【原文：Chinese state-backed developers are starting to buy land at a premium again after the government eased limits on home prices to revive a slumping market that’s been a drag on the economy for more than four years.】

item.title: 韩国经济刺激计划引发债务市场融资担忧
item.description: 韩国希望通过财政刺激来解决经济放缓问题，这将给韩元带来压力，并可能使收益率曲线陡峭化，而此时债券市场已经在吸收创纪录的发行量。【原文：South Korea’s bid to tackle a slowing economy via fiscal stimulus will pressure the won and may steepen the yield curve at a time when the bond market is already absorbing a record amount of issuance.】

item.title: 印度尼西亚新达纳塔拉投资基金准备启动
item.description: 印尼对其强大的国有企业的运营方式进行了全面改革，这将创建一个数十亿美元的投资工具，为总统普拉博沃-苏比安托（Prabowo Subianto）提供大量资金，用于推动经济增长。【原文：A sweeping overhaul of how Indonesia runs its powerful state companies will create a multibillion-dollar investment vehicle that could give President Prabowo Subianto a major cache of funds to deploy in his effort to supercharge growth.】

item.title: 奥兰集团确认向沙特基金出售农业业务股权
item.description: Olam Group Ltd. 已确认将以 17.8 亿美元的价格向一家沙特国有投资公司出售其农业综合企业 44.6% 的股份。【原文：Olam Group Ltd. has confirmed it will sell its 44.6% stake in its agribusiness to a state-owned Saudi investment firm for $1.78 billion.】

item.title: 新西兰零售销售反弹标志经济衰退已结束
item.description: 2024 年最后三个月，新西兰的零售支出出现反弹，这进一步表明，较低的利率正在帮助新西兰经济走出衰退。【原文：New Zealand retail spending rebounded in the final three months of 2024, adding to signs that lower interest rates are helping the economy emerge from recession.】

item.title: 华尔街暴跌后亚洲股市将下跌：市场综述
item.description: 由于美国经济数据乏善可陈，华尔街创下了今年以来最差的一个交易日，亚洲股市随之下跌。欧元在德国大选后走强。【原文：Stocks in Asia were primed to fall after Wall Street notched up its worst session of the year on lacklustre US economic data. The euro strengthened following an election in Germany.】

item.title: Perpetual 将寻求出售财富管理业务，拒绝 KKR 交易
item.description: Perpetual Ltd. 表示，在拒绝 KKR & Co. 的最新收购要约后，将继续出售其财富管理业务，这家澳大利亚金融服务公司正试图吸引新的收购要约。【原文：Perpetual Ltd. said it will pursue the sale of its wealth management business after rejecting the latest offer from KKR & Co., as the Australian financial services firm attempts to lure new offers.】

item.title: 本周全球商品市场值得关注的五大图表
item.description: 低迷的石油交易商将在本周伦敦举行的一次重要能源会议上寻找线索。由于市场提供了套利机会，黄金继续涌入美国。欧洲的液化天然气价格随着供应担忧的减弱而显示出缓和的迹象。【原文：Subdued oil traders will be looking for clues at a major energy conference in London this week. Gold continues to pour into the US as the market provides arbitrage opportunities. And the price of liquefied natural gas in Europe is showing signs of easing as supply concerns take a step back.】

item.title: WiseTech 董事会辞职，创始人怀特赢得权力斗争
item.description: 慧科全球有限公司（WiseTech Global Ltd. ）的创始人兼最大股东理查德-怀特（Richard White）似乎在一场高层权力纷争中取得了胜利，此前几乎所有董事会成员都因对这位亿万富翁在公司中的角色产生分歧而退出了董事会。公司股价暴跌。【原文：WiseTech Global Ltd.’s founder and largest shareholder Richard White appears to have triumphed in a high-level power dispute after almost every board member quit in a disagreement over the billionaire’s role at the company. The shares slumped.】

item.title: 伊拉克将从库尔德斯坦获得 18.5 万桶石油，出口即将重启
item.description: 伊拉克石油部一位副部长周日告诉国营伊拉克通讯社，在恢复通过输油管道向土耳其出口原油后，伊拉克每天将从库尔德斯坦半自治地区获得约 18.5 万桶原油，但未提供具体时间。【原文：Iraq will receive around 185,000 barrels of crude oil a day from the semi-autonomous region of Kurdistan after exports resume via a pipeline to Turkey, a deputy Iraqi oil minister told the state-run Iraqi News Agency on Sunday without providing a time frame.】

item.title: 财报季只会让首席财务官更难做
item.description:
面对不确定性，企业希望降低成本，提高效率。此外，空中客车公司的财务总监将谈论关税、国防开支和供应链。【原文：

Facing uncertainty, companies look to trim costs and become more efficient. Plus, the finance chief of Airbus talks about tariffs, defense spending and supply chains.

】

item.title: 瑞曼医疗保健公司大幅折价 5.7 亿美元削减债务
item.description: 新西兰退休村业主莱曼医疗保健公司（Ryman Healthcare）将以大幅折价的方式融资 10 亿新西兰元（约合 5.7 亿美元），以加强其资产负债表，这是该公司重振经营业绩的最新举措。【原文：New Zealand retirement village owner Ryman Healthcare is raising NZ$1 billion ($570 million) at a deep discount to strengthen its balance sheet in the latest step to revive business performance.】
